question: In the plot above, what do components with very low variance ratio probably represent?

answers.answer: Noise in the data characterized by few expression values causing small variance
answers.feedback: Correct! If the expression has only few values>0 there will be very little variance on those dimensions of the data, and the ratio compared to the previous dimension's variance will be small.

answers.answer: Principal components describing count distribution in the data
answers.feedback: Nope :( Principal Components do not really have anything to do with that

answers.answer: Projection of those dimensions where background genes have very constant expression across all cells
answers.feedback: Exact. When a gene has constant expression, the variance is very low and such gene does not contribute to the PCA.

answers.answer: The projection of rare cluster of cells present in the single cell data
answers.feedback: No, those should eventually be part of the first PCA components
